result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sam S Disher

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Sam Disher in court with attorney Stephen Walter Sawyer. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 12CM243, 12CF59, 12CF218, 14CF13, 14CF37

Atty Sawyer indicates there are a number of issues to be resolved.  Makes statements to the Court. 
Files a post plea waiver form he created to cover the defect in the plea/questionnaire waiver. 
In 14CF13 files a preliminary hearing waiver. 

To be dismissed and read-in: 14CF13.  There has been no preliminary hearing. 
14CF37 has not been addressed as a plea hearing.  Defendant will enter a plea of guilty or no contest. 
12CF59 and 12CF218 are set for a sentencing hearing today. 

Atty Sawyer indicates there is a misdemeanor in 12CM243.  There was a guilty plea to count 1 and count 2 was dismissed and read-in. 

Court reviews:
12CM243:  Plea entered, sentencing today.
14CF13: there was no prelim, waiver of prelim and filing of information and not guilty plea.  Then dismissed and read-in after the not guilty plea is entered. 
12CF59 is here for sentencing. 
12CF218 is here for sentencing. 
14CF37 there will be a plea with a recommendation of current. 

- 14CF13 - 
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
NOT GUILTY Plea entered.
Court accepts the not guilty plea. 

- 14CF37 - 
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties. 
Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty in 14CF37.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Court proceeds now on the sentencing in all files: 
Court received the original PSI in March 2014.  On August 11, 2014 the Court received an amended PSI. 
Atty Cousins and Atty Sawyer received both the PSI and the Amended PSI.  Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing. 
Court asks parties to file recusal form for each file. 

Court makes statements.  Does not know the defendant or his mother.  Knew the grandparents and one of the sons of the grandparents.  He has not talked to any member of the families and has not spoken to anyone.  
State does not have any objection to proceeding. 
Atty Sawyer takes time to discuss this information with his client. 
Court has received the Statement re: Recusal.  
Atty Sawyer does not object to the Court proceeding based on the recent information. 

Atty Sawyer states corrections to the amended PSI. 
Court notes the corrections. 
Atty Cousins states has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.  No victims are present. 
Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sawyer makes sentencing arguments to the Court.  Would like to have a restitution hearing scheduled. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
12CF59 Count 1 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 7 1/2 years:
Serve 360 days in jail, commencing immediately. 
Huber for going to work and any AODA treatment or any counseling. 
(Credit to be agreed upon by the attorney's)
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations and aftercare.
Complete anger management.
Complete psychological assessment and comply with recommendations. 
100 hours community service.
No contact with Kacy Kirkland, Garrett Bryan, John Nelson, Kody Kieliszewski, Cody Quick, Evan Firkus, William Ouimet, or James Schultz.
Maintain fulltime employment or school or combination equaling fulltime.
Write letter of apology to Kacy Kirland.  Provide to agent to forward to victim. 
Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge. 
Pay costs. 
Pay restitution:  To be determined.  There will be a separate restitution hearing.  That is to be requested in writing thru the Court Commissioner. 
Pay restitution for 12CM243 - $60.45 to Bancroft Quik 303.95 to Snap On Tools.  (These amounts are stipulated)

12CF59 Count 13 -
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 5 years, concurrent:
Serve 360 days in jail, concurrent with Count 1.  Sentence to commence immediately. 
Same huber privileges.
Pay costs.
Same conditions as Count 1. 

12CF218 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 5 years, concurrent. 
Serve 360 days in jail, concurrent with Count 1.  Sentence to commence immediately. 
Same huber privileges.
Comply with conditions in 12CF59. 
Pay costs. 

14CF37 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 5 years, concurrent. 
Serve 360 days in jail, concurrent with Count 1.  Sentence to commence immediately. 
Same huber privileges.
Comply with conditions in 12CF218 and 12CF59. 
Pay costs. 

12CM243 - 
Serve 180 days jail, concurrent with conditional probation sentence. 
Same huber privileges.
Sentence to commence immediately. 
Pay costs. 

14CF13 is dismissed and read-in. 

Court advises Post-Conviction Relief. 

Atty Cousins questions restitution.  Provides the Court with 3 restitution summaries.

Plea/sentencing hearing on August 13, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on August 13, 2014 at 09:00 am.
from Atty Sawyer w/letter and report dated June 11, 2014 from Jay Cleve, PhD. (original filed in 12CF221)

Defendant Sam S Disher in court with attorney Stephen W Sawyer. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to Withdraw Plea.  Atty Sawyer states matter today was to be Motion hearing to withdraw plea on 12CF221 only as reasons stated on the record to the Court re: plea to substantial, not aggravated which have different max penalties  and may cause a defect to 12CF218 case and that the PSI report may have problems as well.
Agent to correct the PSI report would take about 30 days mentioned by the Court.  
ADA Cousins states previous recommendation would be withdrawn as to concurrent sentences and would be recommending consecutive sentencing.

BTC:  
12CF221 Plea withdrawn granted - to be set for Jury Trial: 09-03-14 at 8:30 a.m.
08-13-14 9:00 for sentencing for the other case and take pleas and sentencing on the two new cases.
Author of PSI to correct due to 12CF221 (Substantial-Battery). Clerk to include minutes.
Motion hearing on June 19, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Sentencing Hearing set for 03/28/14 - new address provided by post office
Order to Withdraw as Counsel - Atty Kessler /s/ JVF 04/01/14 - GRANTED
Status conference on April 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Sam Disher in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF13, 14CF37, 12CF59, 12CF218, 12CF221, 12CM243
Court notes this matter was set for a sentencing hearing the other day.  An error in the crime charged on the PSI.  Since then, Court has learned that Atty Kessler wishes to withdraw.  
Atty Kessler makes arguments to the Court regarding her motion. 
Court questions defendant. 
Defendant agrees.  This is what he wants. 

BY THE COURT: 
Motion to withdraw is granted. 
Atty Kessler to prepare the order for signature. 

Atty Kessler will provide all discovery documents organized and send to the new attorney.  She will also notify the public defender of the new date.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on March 28, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Sam Disher in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court received the PSI yesterday. 
Atty Cousins received a copy. 
Atty Kessler indicates she received a copy on Monday. 
Atty Kessler indicates there may be significant errors in the PSI.  Will need time to investigate those errors and argumentative sentence and corrections to the PSI. 
Atty Cousins opposes any adjournment.  Error refers to the title of the charge re: substantial vs. aggravated battery.  Victims are present.  Had no information that the hearing was going to be adjourned until moment.  
Atty Kessler makes additional arguments.  Defendant plead to substantial and not aggravated.  May be withdrawing plea. 
Atty Cousins makes additional arguments. 

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 28, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant's Date Corrected in Probable Cause

to be heard at 1:15 p.m. today.  DA case #13FE560.
Anticipated: Bail Jump
  Court calls case at         .
ADA  appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of .
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court questions the defendant.
State request $2,000 sig bond:
BTC:  $2,000 sig bond
to be set as a status to follow other cases in March .
